topic.title: Zeronet usage stats
topic.body: Is there somewhere where I can check stats on Zeronet usage with time?

1_16XR1GVbekHSMMoUZ5pTQWFpq2anbkHgrC.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_150_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): The stats page has some information about what ZeroNet is doing. You can also slide the 'home button' in the top right to open a sidebar that has some info on how many people you're connected to, and the geo-info you're getting.

Yeah, it displays only current usage though. I was wondering if someone would be aggregating these with time and posting the evolution on some website.

> [kaffie](#comment_151_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I'm not aware of anything like that. ZeroNet is still really new. I'd say if this is something you're interested in, you should make something like it yourself.

Yeah, sounds like a nice side project. Just want to check before reinventing the wheel.

> [grez](#comment_27_19arYgVKguUamTqtYGu6T9FSUsr19CyEcG): What do you mean by "stats on ZeroNet usage"? What it will include and measure?

I most interested in the number of peers at a given time (various resolutions), but it would apply to any other measurable attributes. I guess this would inherently be a per-website metric, and I'm wondering if aggregating these would give insights into global ZeroNet usage with time.
